data.title: Clamped Lerp
data.body: Added a Clamped Lerp to Vector3

data.title: AnimationController - Bug fix
data.body: Added a null check to the AnimationController's animations array.

data.title: Search Bar Update
data.body: Moved the search implementation to where the other widget events are eing handled.

data.title: [AtomicTool] Cannot run net compile command on machine other than the one that built the tool
data.body: AtomicTool is looking for the AtomicTool templates under the code root path generated in the project when running CMake. Should be able to specify an alternate AtomicNET or Resources path.

data.title: Reparent multiple nodes
data.body: If you have multiple nodes selected you can drag all of them and reparent them to a single parent

data.title: Animation Transition Fix
data.body:
Resetting the skeleton of a mesh each frame causes animation blending to not work as hoped/expected when transitioning from one animation to another, involving a regression toward the base/T pose. This reset doesn't seem to really be necessary, and it looks like it would be fine to simply lerp from the last position of the skeleton into the new animation frames.

This change removes the skeleton reset, and appears to work well for the cases tested of blending between animations.

data.title: [macOS/Linux/C#] - Only build for desktop when building from the AtomicEditor
data.body:
We're building iOS/Android from AtomicEditor when we are building the project assembly, when building from the editor, specify the desktop platform to msbuild/xbuild to speed things up

Edit: This currently works on Windows, look into why it isn't working with xbuild on macOS/Linux.  Possibly the swapping of '.' to '_' in target name which is necessary under msbuild?

data.title: Native Events (typesafe), Object lifetime work, Scene/Component improvements, additional native bindings, fixes, and more
data.body: This PR adds typesafe Native Event generation to the script binding tool.  Work has been done on object lifetimes with a multi-Features Example which can load and unload scenes from memory, component updates are now properly tied to the scene they are in (instead of globally), more native bindings, bug fixes, overall a hearty PR

data.title: Fixes #1074
data.body: I kept running into this one since I've been on the move lately. It was simpler to fix than I thought it might be.

data.title: Upgrade Monaco to 0.7
data.body:
Monaco 0.7 just released and this updates to that version.  

Monaco changes can be found at https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#070

Additionally, the following were fixed in Atomic:
- changed the whitespace setting to match the new whitespace setting in Monaco ("none","all","border") instead of true/false.  An adapter was put in so that existing true/false entries still work.
- discovered that the monaco web workers weren't being utilized, so fixed that so that monaco can run some stuff in a background thread
- discovered that comments weren't being displayed in hovers/intellisense correctly, so that was also added

data.title: Editor crashes when laptop wakes
data.body:
On my laptop, the editor crashes when it wakes from a sleep.

It seems to be related to trying CEF and graphics objects.

I don't have much information, but it's pretty easy to reproduce.

data.title: C# binding has short instead of unsigned short
data.body: MasterServerClient ConnectToMaster has a second parameter of unsigned short. In C# this is a short, which prevents you from entering ports greater than 32767.

data.title: Add "Wait For Debugger" option to Dev->Pluginst->AtomicNET

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.title: [Build] Add flag for RelWithDebInfo to Build_AtomicEditor.bat
data.body:
We currently have a --debug flag, though we need to factor in release builds that contain debug info

This is useful for debugging issues with release code and will cover the editor, AtomicNET native, and platform native code

data.title: Minor enhancements and a try/catch to prevent dll parsing from failing
data.body:
The first three commits are harmless/simple

The last one (wrap InlineField handling..) is related to the issue I was having last week. The parser is stumbling on components that have no constructor, and no explicit inline assigned values. This is a complete showstopper, so until a better solution can be found I'm wrapping the source of the exception in a try/catch.

The loadedValues still gets cleared, so parsing of the rest of the component (and other components in the assembly) still succeeds. Should .ctor processing perhaps just be skipped entirely?

data.title: Deployment for linux platform
data.body:
This PR adds Linux to the list of platform deployables. This is a deployment is in the same vein as the legacy deployments, using the linux built AtomicPlayer and adding the AtomicResource.pak to make a complete program. It does not do linux C# programs (yet).
Note: There is a small issue with execution bits on the AtomicPlayer program, when deployed, the AtomicPlayer is copied from one file to another, which removes the linux execution bits, because a new file is created. I fixed this linux on linux, but if a linux program deployed on windows or osx, and the program is moved back to linux, it will not execute. The user can restore the execute function, but it's still a little disconcerting, and no cross-platform solution (other than doing an actual os copy).

data.title: Possible fix for OS X resource prefix issue (specify absolute path based on executable in app bundle)
Use VSMSBuildCmd.bat instead of vcvars64.bat for editor C# builds (the later requires C++ tooling to be installed)
linux package cleanup
data.body:
The initial package was good, but was not detecting if a version was already installed, which was an annoyance.  In tracking down more lintian errors, I found the I wasn't following enough rules to make the package manager happy. With these changes, now it is, and the number of remaining lintian errors, though valid, is small and manageable.
Change the package install directory name to (all lowercase) atomicgameengine.
All files do not have the execute bit set, except for AtomicEditor and AtomicPlayer, which are also stripped.
Remove all embedded .gitignore files.
Removed Depend package version number checks, they were not needed.
Fixed warning about using /tmp directory usage during installation.
Change the deb package filename to match the naming format of the other platform packages.

data.title: Adding TypeScript decl.
data.body: Continuation of #1054.

data.title: [WIndows Vista] - PowerCreateRequest entry not found in kernel32.dll
data.body: Investigate this error when running the editor on Windows Vista.  Vista was released 10 years ago and has a pretty small install base at this point, though the player should run on it.  This probably comes down to some compatibility flags, though it is possible binary CEF has a vista issue.

data.title: Make the AtomicNET requirement buttons more clear, always cleanly create the editor target folder regardless of noclean option
Linux package generation
data.body: This will create a linux debian package from the ./Build_AtomicEditor.sh  --package command.

data.title: Adds a prompt for breaking prefabs so changes aren't unintentionally lost
[JavaScript] - Add ability to pick additional overloads with rename in package json
data.body: AtomicTool now parses overloads as C# bindings support them.  JS doesn't support overloads (without error prone runtime arg introspection) and we specify which overload to use in the package json.  We should be able to specify additional method signatures with rename, so process for exposing additional overloads doesn't have to be hand done.

data.title: Pick overload for NavigationMesh::Build
Implement cross platform solution to ensure project CSComponent assemblies are preloaded at runtime
data.body: In some cases, there are external assemblies which contain CSComponents. If these components are solely referenced in the scene graph, they will not be loaded.  So, we need a way to make sure CSComponents in the project are preloaded.  Being careful not to double load, etc (see #1055)

data.title: Project assemblies are being referenced by AtomicNET projects in development builds

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body: Atomic project assemblies should not be referenced by core AtomicNET assemblies in development build solutions

data.title: We're doubling loading assemblies in some cases, don't do that
CSComponents reference a different assembly to that referenced by .csproj
data.body:
Methods like Node.GetCSComponent no longer work because the type comparison between the required type and the type of the actual component fails.
This appears to be because they are sourced from different dlls: 

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/278871/18943803/1ea3f652-8622-11e6-9016-cd09f3900457.PNG)

This can be reproduced with the test project at https://github.com/LumaDigital/AtomicTests/tree/MB_CSharpExternalDllTest/CSharpTests/ExternalDllTest
